section: THIS JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") made and entered into this 20th day of Friday, March 2020 (the "Execution Date"),
explanation: The phrase "20th day of Friday, March 2020" is structurally flawed. March 20, 2020, was a Friday, but the phrasing is unconventional and grammatically incorrect. It should be "the 20th day of March, 2020, a Friday" or similar.

section: The Purpose of the Venture will be determined by the Managers.
explanation: This section lacks structural clarity. While it states the purpose will be determined by the managers, it doesn't define how the purpose is to be documented, amended, or communicated. This structural flaw introduces ambiguity and potential future disputes regarding the scope and direction of the venture's activities because the purpose is not well-defined or set.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The structural flaw in the capitalization description for JVLS, LLC's initial contribution is difficult to understand. It's unclear from the language whether the $60,000 represents a fixed amount, a monthly amount tied to government contracts, or some other arrangement. Furthermore, the addition of "Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue..." creates further ambiguity as to the total contribution amount and the frequency of the 10% payments. Also, the wording "In Addition to The Total Contributions" does not make sense as it is poorly structured.

section: The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Members at a regular or special meeting will be required.
explanation: This section contains a structural flaw because the term 'major issues' is not clearly defined within the agreement. This can create ambiguity and lead to disputes amongst the members on what is regarded as a major issue and what isn't.

section:
Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows:
Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The formatting and structure of this section (13) with the table are poor, creating a structural flaw in the agreement. The mixing of bullet points and paragraphs makes it hard to read. There is also no ending to the table.

section: Capital Contributions may be amended from time to time, according to the requirements of the Venture, by decision of the Members as recommended by the Managers. Where Members' interests are affected, additional capital contributions (the "Additional Capital Contributions") must have the unanimous consent of the Members.
explanation: This section has a structural flaw that is unclear as it is difficult to follow. It is poorly structured and not easily understood. Also, it is vague as to what needs to be done in order to change the current contributions.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined in a manner deemed appropriate by the remaining members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be determined at the discretion of the remaining members.
explanation: This section has a structural flaw because the wording is vague. It is not clear in what circumstances this part of the contract will occur, and leaves to much power for a negative outcome to occur against a member.

section: THIS JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") made and entered into this 20th day of Friday, March 2020 (the "Execution Date"),
explanation: The legal term "Execution Date" is used, but the structuring of the statement does not make sense. It would read better and be clearer to say "made and entered into on March 20th, 2020 (the "Execution Date")"
